member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.KernelProcessThreadLifetime
member.summary: Defines the policy for how threads are managed in the process.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.KernelProcessThreadLifetime.Scoped
member.summary: The thread is created when the process is created. The thread id is saved in the process state and will be reused within the scope of a process instance. Scoped threads can be shared between steps.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.KernelProcessThreadLifetime.Transient
member.summary: A new thread is created every time a step in the process uses it. The thread id is not saved in the process state. Transient threads cannot be shared between steps.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.KernelProcessThreadType
member.summary: Represents the type of a thread in a kernel process.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.KernelProcessThreadType.ChatCompletion
member.summary: A thread is a general chat completion type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.KernelProcessThreadType.AzureAI
member.summary: A thread is an AzureAI or Foundry type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowWrapper
member.summary: A wrapper class that encapsulates the workflow definition for serialization and deserialization. This class serves as the root container for workflow configurations in both YAML and JSON formats.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowWrapper.Workflow
member.summary: Gets or sets the workflow definition contained within this wrapper. This property represents the complete workflow specification including all nodes, orchestration, and error handling.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow
member.summary: Represents the main workflow specification that defines the complete structure and behavior of a workflow. A workflow consists of nodes, orchestration steps, variables, schemas, and error handling configurations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the workflow. This ID should be unique across all workflows within the system and is used for workflow identification and referencing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.FormatVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the format version of the workflow specification. This version indicates the schema version used to define the workflow and ensures compatibility with the execution engine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.WorkflowVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the workflow implementation. This version tracks the evolution of the workflow definition and allows for versioning of workflow logic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the human-readable name of the workflow. This name is used for display purposes and should clearly identify the workflow's purpose.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional description of the workflow. This description provides additional context about the workflow's purpose, behavior, and usage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.SuggestedInputs
member.summary: Gets or sets the suggested inputs for the workflow. These inputs provide examples or recommendations for how the workflow should be invoked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Inputs
member.summary: Gets or sets the input configuration for the workflow. This defines what types of inputs the workflow accepts, including events and messages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Variables
member.summary: Gets or sets the variables defined within the workflow scope. These variables can be used throughout the workflow for state management and data passing between nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Schemas
member.summary: Gets or sets the schemas used within the workflow. These schemas define the structure and validation rules for data used throughout the workflow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Nodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of nodes that make up the workflow. Each node represents a step or component in the workflow execution graph.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.Orchestration
member.summary: Gets or sets the orchestration steps that define the workflow execution flow. These steps specify the conditions and actions that control how the workflow progresses from node to node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Workflow.ErrorHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the error handling configuration for the workflow. This defines how the workflow should respond to and recover from errors during execution.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableType
member.summary: Defines the possible types of variables that can be used within a workflow. Variables can represent different data structures and have different behaviors during workflow execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableType.Thread
member.summary: A thread type variable that represents a conversation thread or execution context. Thread variables maintain state and context across multiple interactions within the workflow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableType.Messages
member.summary: A message type variable that represents a collection of messages. Messages variables are used to store and pass communication data between workflow components.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableType.UserDefined
member.summary: A user-defined variable with custom structure and behavior. User-defined variables allow for flexible data types specific to the workflow's requirements.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableDefinition
member.summary: Represents the definition of a variable within a workflow, including its type, default value, and schema. Variable definitions specify how variables should be initialized and validated during workflow execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableDefinition.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the variable. The type determines how the variable is handled and what operations can be performed on it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableDefinition.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value of the variable. This value is used to initialize the variable when the workflow starts if no other value is provided.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableDefinition.Schema
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema definition for the variable. The schema defines the structure, validation rules, and constraints for the variable's value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SuggestedInputs
member.summary: Contains suggested input configurations that provide guidance on how to invoke the workflow. Suggested inputs help users understand the expected input format and provide examples for workflow execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SuggestedInputs.Events
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of suggested events that can be used to trigger the workflow. These events serve as examples or templates for valid workflow inputs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SuggestedEvent
member.summary: Represents a suggested event that demonstrates how to trigger the workflow with specific input data. Suggested events provide examples of valid event types and their associated payloads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SuggestedEvent.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type identifier of the suggested event. This type should match one of the event types that the workflow is configured to handle.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SuggestedEvent.Payload
member.summary: Gets or sets the payload data for the suggested event. The payload contains the data structure and values that would be passed with this type of event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Inputs
member.summary: Defines the input configuration for a workflow, specifying what types of data the workflow can accept. Inputs can include both events and message collections, allowing for flexible workflow triggering mechanisms.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Inputs.Events
member.summary: Gets or sets the event input configuration for the workflow. This defines which types of events can trigger the workflow and how they should be processed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Inputs.Messages
member.summary: Gets or sets the message input configuration for the workflow. This allows the workflow to be triggered with a collection of messages rather than events.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.InputEvents
member.summary: Contains the event input configuration for a workflow, defining which events can trigger execution. Event inputs allow workflows to be triggered by various types of external or internal events.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.InputEvents.CloudEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of cloud events that can trigger the workflow. Cloud events follow the CloudEvents specification and provide a standardized way to describe events.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Messages
member.summary: Represents a collection of messages that can be used as input to a workflow. This class extends List to provide a strongly-typed collection for message objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.CloudEvent
member.summary: Represents a CloudEvent that can trigger workflow execution. CloudEvents provide a standardized format for describing events in a vendor-neutral way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.CloudEvent.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the cloud event. The event type identifies the nature of the event and determines how it should be processed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.CloudEvent.DataSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets the data schema for the cloud event's payload. The data schema defines the structure and validation rules for the event's data content.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.CloudEvent.Filters
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of filters that determine whether this event should trigger the workflow. Filters allow for conditional processing based on event content or metadata.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ProcessFilter
member.summary: Represents a filter condition that can be applied to events or other workflow data. Filters are used to conditionally process or route data based on specified criteria.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ProcessFilter.FilterExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the filter expression that defines the condition. The expression is evaluated against the event or data to determine if the filter matches.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Variable
member.summary: Represents a variable within the workflow context, including its type, default value, and access controls. Variables provide state management and data sharing capabilities within the workflow execution environment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Variable.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type identifier of the variable. The type determines how the variable is stored, accessed, and manipulated during execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Variable.Default
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value assigned to the variable when it is first created. This value is used if no explicit initialization value is provided.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Variable.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope in which the variable is accessible. Scope determines which parts of the workflow can read and modify the variable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Variable.IsMutable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the variable can be modified after initialization. Immutable variables provide read-only access after their initial assignment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Variable.Acls
member.summary: Gets or sets the access control list (ACL) that defines which nodes can access this variable. ACLs provide fine-grained security control over variable access within the workflow.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowAccessControl
member.summary: Defines an access control entry that specifies permissions for a workflow node to access a variable. Access control entries provide security and isolation by restricting variable access to authorized nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowAccessControl.Node
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the node that is granted access. This should match the ID of a node defined in the workflow's node collection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowAccessControl.Access
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of access granted to the node. Access levels typically include read, write, or read-write permissions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowSchema
member.summary: Represents a schema definition used to validate and structure data within the workflow. Schemas ensure data integrity and provide a contract for data exchange between workflow components.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowSchema.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the schema (e.g., object, array, string). The type defines the fundamental structure that the schema validates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowSchema.Properties
member.summary: Gets or sets the properties defined within the schema. Properties specify the individual fields and their validation rules for object-type schemas.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowSchema.Required
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of required property names within the schema. Required properties must be present in any data that conforms to this schema.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaProperty
member.summary: Represents a property definition within a schema, including its type, constraints, and references. Schema properties define the validation rules and structure for individual fields within a schema.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaProperty.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the data type of the schema property. The type determines what kind of values are valid for this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaProperty.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the item definition for array-type properties. This defines the structure and validation rules for elements within an array property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaProperty.Ref
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to another schema definition. References allow for reuse of schema definitions and creation of complex nested structures.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaItems
member.summary: Defines the schema for items within an array-type schema property. Schema items specify how individual elements in an array should be validated and structured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaItems.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the data type of the array items. This type applies to each individual element within the array.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node
member.summary: Represents a single node within the workflow execution graph. Nodes are the fundamental building blocks of a workflow, each performing a specific task or operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the node within the workflow. This ID is used to reference the node in orchestration steps and other workflow configurations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the node, which determines its behavior and capabilities. Node types define the category of operation that the node performs within the workflow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the node implementation. Versioning allows for evolution of node behavior while maintaining backward compatibility.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional description of the node's purpose and behavior. Descriptions provide documentation and context for understanding the node's role in the workflow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.Agent
member.summary: Gets or sets the agent definition associated with this node. Agents provide the actual implementation and execution logic for the node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.HumanInLoopType
member.summary: Gets or sets the human-in-the-loop (HITL) mode for this node. HITL mode determines when and how human intervention is required during node execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.Inputs
member.summary: Gets or sets the input configuration for the node. Inputs define what data the node expects to receive when it is executed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.AgentInputMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping configuration for agent inputs. This mapping defines how workflow data is transformed and passed to the associated agent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.OnError
member.summary: Gets or sets the actions to be executed when the node encounters an error. Error actions provide a mechanism for graceful error handling and recovery.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Node.OnComplete
member.summary: Gets or sets the actions to be executed when the node completes successfully. Completion actions allow for post-processing and workflow continuation logic.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowAgent
member.summary: Represents an agent configuration within a workflow node. Agents provide the concrete implementation for node functionality and define how the node operates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowAgent.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the agent. The agent type determines the implementation class and capabilities available to the node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.WorkflowAgent.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the agent instance. This ID can be used to reference specific agent configurations or implementations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.AgentInputType
member.summary: Defines the different types of input handling modes for agents within workflow nodes. Input types determine how data is passed to and processed by the agent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.AgentInputType.Thread
member.summary: Inputs are assumed to be part of the conversation thread and are not passed separately. In this mode, the agent reads input from the current thread context.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.AgentInputType.Structured
member.summary: The agent expects structured input data passed directly as parameters. This mode provides explicit data passing with defined structure and validation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.NodeInputs
member.summary: Represents the input configuration for a workflow node. Node inputs define the expected data structure and schema for information passed to the node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.NodeInputs.Schema
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema reference for the node's input structure. The schema defines the validation rules and structure for data passed to this node.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaReference
member.summary: Represents a reference to a schema definition. Schema references allow for reuse of schema definitions across multiple workflow components.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.SchemaReference.Ref
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference path to the schema definition. This reference follows JSON Schema reference syntax to point to another schema.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.OnEventAction
member.summary: Represents an action that can be executed in response to a workflow event. Event actions provide the mechanism for conditional logic and dynamic workflow behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.OnEventAction.OnCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition that must be met for this action to execute. Conditions allow for sophisticated conditional logic based on workflow state and event data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessConditionType
member.summary: Defines the types of conditions that can be used in workflow decision-making. Condition types determine how and when conditional logic is evaluated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessConditionType.Eval
member.summary: A condition that evaluates a custom expression against the current workflow state. Eval conditions provide maximum flexibility for custom conditional logic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessConditionType.Always
member.summary: A condition that always evaluates to true, regardless of context. Always conditions provide unconditional execution paths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessConditionType.Default
member.summary: A default condition that activates when no other conditions are met. Default conditions provide fallback behavior for unmatched scenarios.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessCondition
member.summary: Represents a condition that controls workflow execution flow and decision-making. Conditions evaluate workflow state and determine which actions should be executed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessCondition.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of condition evaluation to perform. The condition type determines how the condition expression is interpreted and evaluated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessCondition.Expression
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression to evaluate for this condition. The expression syntax depends on the condition type and evaluation context.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessCondition.Emits
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of events to emit when this condition is satisfied. Event emissions allow conditions to trigger additional workflow behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.DeclarativeProcessCondition.Updates
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of variable updates to perform when this condition is satisfied. Variable updates allow conditions to modify workflow state as part of their execution.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.EventEmission
member.summary: Represents an event emission that occurs when a condition is satisfied or an action is executed. Event emissions provide a way to communicate state changes and trigger reactions throughout the workflow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.EventEmission.EventType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type identifier of the event being emitted. The event type determines how the event is processed and which listeners will respond to it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.EventEmission.Schema
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema reference for the event's payload structure. The schema ensures that emitted events conform to expected data structures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.EventEmission.Payload
member.summary: Gets or sets the data payload included with the emitted event. The payload contains the actual data that will be passed to event listeners.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionExpression
member.summary: Represents a condition expression that can be evaluated against workflow data. Condition expressions provide structured conditional logic for workflow decision-making.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionExpression.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the variable or data being evaluated. The path uses dot notation to navigate through complex data structures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionExpression.Operator
member.summary: Gets or sets the comparison operator used in the condition. The operator determines how the value at the path is compared to the condition value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionExpression.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to compare against the path value. This value is used with the operator to determine if the condition is satisfied.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionOperator
member.summary: Defines the comparison operators available for use in condition expressions. Operators determine how values are compared in conditional logic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionOperator.Equal
member.summary: Tests whether two values are equal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionOperator.NotEqual
member.summary: Tests whether two values are not equal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionOperator.GreaterThan
member.summary: Tests whether the left value is greater than the right value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionOperator.LessThan
member.summary: Tests whether the left value is less than the right value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionOperator.GreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: Tests whether the left value is greater than or equal to the right value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ConditionOperator.LessThanOrEqual
member.summary: Tests whether the left value is less than or equal to the right value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.StateUpdateOperations
member.summary: Defines the types of operations that can be performed when updating workflow state variables. Update operations provide different ways to modify variable values during workflow execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.StateUpdateOperations.Set
member.summary: Sets the variable to a specific value, replacing any existing value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.StateUpdateOperations.Increment
member.summary: Increments the variable's value by a specified amount. This operation is typically used with numeric variables.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.StateUpdateOperations.Decrement
member.summary: Decrements the variable's value by a specified amount. This operation is typically used with numeric variables.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.HITLMode
member.summary: Defines the modes for human-in-the-loop (HITL) interaction within workflow nodes. HITL modes determine when and how human intervention is required during workflow execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.HITLMode.Always
member.summary: Always requires human input before the node can proceed with execution. This mode ensures that human oversight is mandatory for every execution of the node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.HITLMode.Never
member.summary: Never requires human input and allows the node to execute automatically. This mode provides fully automated execution without human intervention.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableUpdate
member.summary: Represents an update operation to be performed on a workflow variable. Variable updates allow workflows to modify state based on conditions and execution flow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableUpdate.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the variable to be updated. The path uses dot notation to specify the exact location of the variable in the state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableUpdate.Operation
member.summary: Gets or sets the operation to be performed on the variable. The operation determines how the variable's value will be modified (set, increment, decrement).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VariableUpdate.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used in the update operation. For set operations, this becomes the new value. For increment/decrement, this is the amount to change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.OrchestrationStep
member.summary: Represents a single step in the workflow orchestration that defines conditional execution logic. Orchestration steps control the flow of execution by listening for events and taking appropriate actions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.OrchestrationStep.ListenFor
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition that this orchestration step listens for. The listen condition determines when this step should be activated and executed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.OrchestrationStep.Then
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of actions to execute when the listen condition is satisfied. These actions define what should happen when the orchestration step is triggered.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenCondition
member.summary: Represents a condition that an orchestration step listens for to determine when to execute its actions. Listen conditions can be based on events, state changes, or complex logical expressions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenCondition.Event
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific event name to listen for. When specified, the condition will trigger when this event is emitted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenCondition.From
member.summary: Gets or sets the source of the event being listened for. This specifies which node or component must emit the event for the condition to trigger.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenCondition.Condition
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom condition expression for more complex logic. This allows for sophisticated conditional logic beyond simple event matching.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenCondition.AllOf
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of events that must all occur for the condition to be satisfied. This provides AND logic for multiple event requirements.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenEvent
member.summary: Represents a specific event to listen for in workflow orchestration. Listen events specify both the event name and its source for precise event matching.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenEvent.Event
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the event to listen for. This identifies the specific type of event that should trigger the condition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ListenEvent.From
member.summary: Gets or sets the source identifier from which the event must originate. This ensures the event comes from the expected node or component.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction
member.summary: Represents an action to be executed as part of workflow orchestration logic. Actions define what should happen when orchestration conditions are met.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of action to be performed. The action type determines the specific operation (node invocation, state update, event emission).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.Node
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the node to execute when the action type is NodeInvocation. This specifies which workflow node should be activated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.Inputs
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mappings to pass to the invoked node. These inputs provide data that the target node needs for execution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.MessagesIn
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression that resolves to messages to be passed to the node. This allows for dynamic message passing based on workflow state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.Thread
member.summary: Gets or sets the thread identifier to send the event to. This specifies which conversation thread should receive the action's output.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the variable to be updated when the action type is Update. This specifies which workflow variable should be modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.Operation
member.summary: Gets or sets the operation to be performed on the variable when the action type is Update. This determines how the variable's value should be changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used in the update operation or as event payload. For updates, this is the value to set, increment by, or decrement by.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.EmitMessageType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of message to emit when the action type is Emit. This specifies what kind of event should be generated by the action.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ThenAction.EmitMessagePayload
member.summary: Gets or sets the payload data to include with the emitted message. This provides the data content that will be sent with the emitted event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ActionType
member.summary: Defines the types of actions that can be performed in workflow orchestration. Action types determine what kind of operation should be executed when conditions are met.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ActionType.NodeInvocation
member.summary: An action that invokes a specific workflow node to execute its logic. Node invocation actions transfer control to another part of the workflow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ActionType.Update
member.summary: An action that updates the value of a workflow variable or state. Update actions allow workflows to modify their internal state during execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ActionType.Emit
member.summary: An action that emits an event to notify other parts of the workflow. Emit actions provide a communication mechanism between workflow components.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VersionRange
member.summary: Represents a version range specification for compatibility checking. Version ranges allow workflows to specify which versions of components they are compatible with.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VersionRange.MinVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum version included in this range. The minimum version is inclusive, meaning this version is considered part of the range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.VersionRange.MaxVersionExclusive
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum version excluded from this range. The maximum version is exclusive, meaning this version is not included in the range.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorHandling
member.summary: Represents the error handling configuration for a workflow. Error handling defines how the workflow should respond to and recover from various types of errors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorHandling.OnError
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific error handling steps that respond to particular error conditions. These steps provide targeted error handling for specific scenarios or error types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorHandling.Default
member.summary: Gets or sets the default actions to be taken when no specific error handling matches. Default actions provide fallback behavior for unexpected or unhandled error conditions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorHandlingStep
member.summary: Represents a single error handling step that responds to specific error conditions. Error handling steps provide conditional logic for responding to different types of errors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorHandlingStep.ListenFor
member.summary: Gets or sets the condition that determines when this error handling step should be activated. The listen condition specifies which error events or conditions trigger this step.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorHandlingStep.Then
member.summary: Gets or sets the actions to execute when the error condition is met. These actions define the error recovery or handling logic for the specific error scenario.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorListenCondition
member.summary: Represents a condition that triggers error handling logic in the workflow. Error listen conditions specify which types of errors should activate error handling steps.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SemanticKernel.ErrorListenCondition.Event
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the error event to listen for. This identifies the specific type of error that should trigger the associated error handling actions.

member.summary: Model diagnostics helper class that provides a set of methods to trace model activities with the OTel semantic conventions. This class contains experimental features and may change in the future. To enable these features, set one of the following switches to true: `Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Experimental.GenAI.EnableOTelDiagnostics` `Microsoft.SemanticKernel.Experimental.GenAI.EnableOTelDiagnosticsSensitive` Or set the following environment variables to true: `SEMANTICKERNEL_EXPERIMENTAL_GENAI_ENABLE_OTEL_DIAGNOSTICS` `SEMANTICKERNEL_EXPERIMENTAL_GENAI_ENABLE_OTEL_DIAGNOSTICS_SENSITIVE`
